content:
Here's an overview of the most popular social media platforms, their user demographics, and some key statistics:

**1. Facebook**

* Users: 2.7 billion monthly active users (MAU)
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 25-34 (44.8%), 35-44 (29.7%), 18-24 (22.5%), 45-54 (16.5%), 55-64 (10.3%), 65+ (4.8%)
	+ Gender: Female (52%), Male (48%)
	+ Income: Middle to upper-middle class
* Features: Social networking, news, entertainment, groups, marketplace

**2. Instagram**

* Users: 1.2 billion MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 18-24 (71%), 25-34 (55.4%), 35-44 (41.2%), 45-54 (30.4%), 55-64 (20.5%), 65+ (10.8%)
	+ Gender: Female (51%), Male (49%)
	+ Income: Middle to upper-middle class
* Features: Visual storytelling, influencer marketing, e-commerce, Reels

**3. YouTube**

* Users: 2 billion MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 18-24 (70.3%), 25-34 (63.2%), 35-44 (55.1%), 45-54 (43.9%), 55-64 (34.5%), 65+ (23.4%)
	+ Gender: Male (55%), Female (45%)
	+ Income: Middle to upper-middle class
* Features: Video sharing, vlogging, educational content, live streaming

**4. TikTok**

* Users: 655.9 million MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 16-24 (60%), 25-34 (30.4%), 35-44 (14.5%), 45-54 (9.2%), 55-64 (4.5%), 65+ (1.4%)
	+ Gender: Female (55%), Male (45%)
	+ Income: Lower to middle class
* Features: Short-form videos, entertainment, music, dance, creativity

**5. Twitter**

* Users: 440 million MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 25-34 (44.1%), 35-44 (31.4%), 18-24 (25.6%), 45-54 (22.1%), 55-64 (14.5%), 65+ (6.3%)
	+ Gender: Male (53%), Female (47%)
	+ Income: Middle to upper-middle class
* Features: Real-time news, discussions, short-form updates, hashtags

**6. Snapchat**

* Users: 290 million MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 18-24 (70.4%), 25-34 (42.9%), 35-44 (25.5%), 45-54 (16.3%), 55-64 (8.2%), 65+ (2.6%)
	+ Gender: Female (57%), Male (43%)
	+ Income: Lower to middle class
* Features: Ephemeral content, stories, filters, lenses

**7. LinkedIn**

* Users: 260 million MAU
* Demographics:
	+ Age: 25-34 (44.3%), 35-44 (33.5%), 45-54 (25.1%), 18-24 (23.3%), 55-64 (16.3%), 65+ (7.5%)
	+ Gender: Male (57%), Female (43%)
	+ Income: Upper-middle class, professionals, entrepreneurs
* Features: Professional
